title: O God Unseen Yet Ever Near

author.name: Edward Osler
author.bio: Edward Osler was an English writer, editor, and hymnologist. He is known for his contributions to hymnody, including 'O God Unseen Yet Ever Near,' which reflects a deep sense of reverence and devotion.

lyrics:
1
O God, unseen yet ever near,
thy presence may we feel;
and, thus inspired with holy fear,
before thine altar kneel.

2
Here may thy faithful people know
the blessings of thy love,
the streams that through the desert flow,
the manna from above.

3
We come, obedient to thy word,
to feast on heavenly food;
our meat the body of the Lord,
our drink his precious blood.

4
Thus may we all thy word obey,
for we, O God, are thine;
and go rejoicing on our way,
renewed with strength divine.
